{"step_by_step_thinking": "The stamp cusp is a term used in dentistry to describe a specific type of cusp on a tooth. It does help to maintain the vertical height of the face, so option A is true. The facial incline might contact in maximum intercuspation (MI), so option B is also true. Sharp cusps and prominent ridges are characteristic features of stamp cusps, so option C is true. Therefore, by process of elimination, the statement that is not true about stamp cusp is option D.", "answer_choice": "D"}
